heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 04 September 2025, lasting 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: There is not a heatwave right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (179°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 55.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 13 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 3.1°C), dew point temperature (up 2.2°C), inside temperature (up 1.5°C), and outside temperature (up 2.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 435.4m higher than yesterday, 690.9m higher than the past week, 276.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 767m minimum and 3570m maximum, with an average of 2290m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1597.0m and 2560m.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and little or no wind. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. The weather will likely remain the same.
